channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report E-2023100845
item.description:
Report E-2023100845

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-08
  • City: MAYVIEW
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver was pulled in for a DOT inspection at the Mayfield MO Scale house during the inspection the officer found a drum was seeping out a small crack in bottom of drum. There was less than and ounce released just enough to leave a small wet spot on the pallet. The drum was packed into a salvage drum to mitigate the release.

item.title: Report E-2023100783
item.description:
Report E-2023100783

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-30T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: OLIVETTE
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver had 4000 gals of DEI in the 1st Compartment, and was moving to the next Compartment where he checked the hose and cam locks which were good. The second he pulled the internal valve, it blew a cam lock off the side of Compartment 3. Estimates 5 to 10 gallons of Diesel spilled onto the cement. Driver cleaned up with spill pads and floor dry. Trailer was repaired and delivery was made the same day with no further issues.

item.title: Report E-2023100657
item.description:
Report E-2023100657

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-10
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 10, 2023, one (1) one-gallon bottle of UN1789 was crushed in transit and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents and swept them in with hand tools. EWI solidified and neutralized the remaining product in the damaged 1-gallon jug and placed it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. All spent absorbents, damaged cardboard, and cleanup debris were placed into one (1) 5-gallon bucket.

item.title: Report X-2023100215
item.description:
Report X-2023100215

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-01T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was recovered from the B Wing and placed in a lined tote. DescribePack: The one can of enamel developed a loose lid and lost its entire contents. No paint clips were found. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in the Hazmat cage on the Flammable Pallet.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was recovered from the A wing and placed in a lined tote. DescribePack: Both Bottles of Natures Force developed loose caps which allowed for a leak to occur. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in the Hazmat cage on the All-Other Materials Pallet.

item.title: Report X-2023091036
item.description:
Report X-2023091036

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The trailer was being unloaded at the PD Doors, Package handler noticed that it was wet. QA was called. Package was put in a plastic hazmat bag and placed in a tote. DescribePack: Loose caps on 1 plastic gallon causing a loss of 5 oz DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in Hazmat bag and tote set in ventilated Hazmat area for processing
